abstract: The color space associated with the color.
overview:
## Discussion

Access this property only for colors that have an associated color space—specifically, colors not created by name or using a pattern image. Accessing it for other color types raises an exception. If you are unsure about a color object, convert it to an equivalent [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpace]-based object before calling this method.

It is safe to access this property for color objects created with the color space names [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/calibratedWhite], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCalibratedBlackColorSpace], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/calibratedRGB], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/deviceWhite], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDeviceBlackColorSpace], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/deviceRGB], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/deviceCMYK], or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/custom]—or with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpace] class methods corresponding to these names.

# colorSpace

**Instance Property**

The color space associated with the color.

## Declaration

```swift
var colorSpace: NSColorSpace { get }
```

## Discussion

Access this property only for colors that have an associated color space—specifically, colors not created by name or using a pattern image. Accessing it for other color types raises an exception. If you are unsure about a color object, convert it to an equivalent [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpace]-based object before calling this method.

It is safe to access this property for color objects created with the color space names [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/calibratedWhite], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCalibratedBlackColorSpace], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/calibratedRGB], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/deviceWhite], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDeviceBlackColorSpace], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/deviceRGB], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/deviceCMYK], or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/custom]—or with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpace] class methods corresponding to these names.

## Related Documentation

- **getComponents(_:)**: Returns the components of the color as an array.
- **numberOfComponents**: The number of components in the color.

## Working with the color space

- **type**: The type of the color object.
- **usingType(_:)**: Returns a version of the color object that is compatible with the specified color type.
- **NSColor.ColorType**: Constants that indicate the color’s type, and which methods may be called on the color object.
- **NSColorSpaceName**: Constants that specify color space names.
